title.rendered: What is PCR Test? | Where to take PCR Test? List of the PCR test center by country

content.rendered:
PCR Test for COVID-19

What is Polymerase chain reaction (PCR) Test?

COVID-19 PCR test will be taken to detect the antigen presence and will determine the person has positive or negative for COVID 19.

How to get ready for PCR test?

Get prepared for your PCR test

For the COVID-19 PCR test, people are requested to follow the below rules

  • Before (at least 30 minutes before) taking the COVID-19 PCR test, do not drink, eat, brush the teeth, smoke
  • Restrain from Alcohol one day before the test.
  • Do not use gargle sprays or liquids, nose balms that include antimicrobial, 48 hours before the test

*COVID-19 Sinopharm Vaccine available places in UAE 

Nationals and the residents of UAE can get the Coronavirus vaccine in Dubai, Abu Dhabi, Al ain, Sharjah, Ajman, Fujairah, Umm al quwain. Check the above link to access the list and the contact details.

Documents required to take PCR test

  • Passport copy
  • Flight itinerary(PNR / Ticket number)

* You may be asked to sign the consent form in the laboratory.

Barbados

Authorized COVID-19 PCR test laboratory in Barbados

Negative PCR COVID-19 test is required to perform with in 72 hours prior to flight departure for passengers arriving from Antigua and Barbuda, Argentina, Australia, Bahamas, Belize, Bermuda, Brazil, Colombia, Cuba, Denmark, Dominican Rep., Estonia, Finland, France, French West Indies, Germany, Ghana, Greece, Guyana, Haiti, Iceland, India, Ireland (Rep.), Italy, Jamaica, Japan, Mexico, Netherlands, New Zealand, Norway, Panama, Peru, Philippines, Puerto Rico, Russian Fed., Saudi Arabia, South Africa, Spain, Sri Lanka, St. Lucia, Suriname, Sweden, Switzerland, Trinidad and Tobago, Turkey, Turks and Caicos Isl., USA, United Arab Emirates, United Kingdom, Venezuela, Virgin Isl. (British) or Virgin Isl. (USA).

Sworn Declaration is required for passengers arriving to Barbados.

All the passengers arriving to Barbados must submit Immigration and Customs Form which is available 72 hours prior to the departure. You must submit atleast 24 hours before your departure. Once you complete the form, save it in your mobile or take a print out which you need to show at Immigration and Customs upon arrival.

Egypt

Traveling to Egypt under COVID-19

Passengers aged above 6 years arriving to Egypt must provide negative PCR test which should be taken 72 hours prior to departure. Test can be taken at any accredited laboratory in your country.

Note: The certificate must be stamped by the laboratory or hospital stated the date, time of the sample test and the details, type of the sample taken for the swab.
